title.narrative: Denmark's core contributions to the International Organization for Migration (IOM) 2018-2022

description.narrative:
IOM is the leading inter-governmental organization in the field of migration. IOM works to help ensure the orderly and humane management of migration, to promote international cooperation on migration issues, to assist in the search for practical solutions to migration problems and to provide humanitarian assistance to migrants in need by providing services and advice to governments and migrants as well as working closely with governmental, intergovernmental and non-governmental partners. IOM works to address humanitarian, development and human mobility challenges.
The project concerns Danish core funding under the Strategy for the partnership between Denmark and the IOM 2018-2022. The Strategy outlines the overall priorities for Denmark’s contributions to and partnership with IOM, and is the central platform for Denmark’s dialogue the organization. The Strategy is guided by the Danish Foreign and Security Policy Strategy 2019-20 and The World 2030 – Denmark’s Strategy for Development Cooperation and Humanitarian Assistance (January 2017), especially in relation to migration and development, countering irregular economic migration and addressing the drivers of irregular migration, and increasing cooperation on returns.
Denmark has the following 2 priority areas for its cooperation with IOM in 2018-2022:
- Priority area 1: Strengthening organizational effectiveness in light of IOM’s new role in the UN system/Making IOM ‘fit for purpose’.
o In light of IOM’s entry into the UN system and its envisaged role in the global UN architecture on migration, particularly in the implementation of and follow-up to the Global Compact on Migration and its coordinating role of the UN Migration Network, Denmark wishes to solidify IOM as the lead agency on migration by supporting its quest to improve and strengthen organizational and policy-making effectiveness and overall performance. The objective of Denmark’s support for IOM is to address complex challenges related to irregular economic migration and the drivers of irregular migration, and to increase cooperation on returns as well as cooperation with international actors that promote safe, orderly, regular and responsible migration.
